slides.title: Welcome to Astrophysics
slides.content:
# Introduction to Astrophysics

Welcome to **Astrophysics** - the physics of the cosmos!

## What You Will Learn:
- **Gravity** - Newton to Einstein
- **Radiation** - Light and electromagnetic spectrum
- **Stellar Physics** - Inside stars
- **Black Holes** - Extreme gravity
- **High-Energy Phenomena** - Extreme universe

> **Fun Fact:** The first black hole image was captured in 2019!

slides.title: Newtonian Gravity
slides.content:
# Newtonian Gravitation

## Newton's Law:
```
F = G x M x m / r^2
```
- G = 6.67 x 10^-11 N m^2/kg^2
- M, m = masses
- r = separation distance

## Orbital Velocity:
```
v = sqrt(GM/r)
```

## Escape Velocity:
```
v_escape = sqrt(2GM/r)
```

## Kepler's Laws:
1. Elliptical orbits
2. Equal areas, equal times
3. T^2 proportional to a^3

slides.title: General Relativity
slides.content:
# Einstein's General Relativity

## Core Idea:
Mass curves spacetime.

## Key Predictions:

| Effect | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| Gravitational time dilation | Clocks slow near mass |
| Gravitational lensing | Light bends around mass |
| Gravitational redshift | Light loses energy climbing out |
| Gravitational waves | Ripples in spacetime |
| Black holes | Complete collapse |

## Confirmation:
- Mercury's orbit precession
- Light bending by Sun (1919)
- Gravitational waves (2015)

slides.title: Electromagnetic Spectrum
slides.content:
# The Electromagnetic Spectrum

## Wavelength Order:

| Type | Wavelength | Detects |
|------|-----------|--------|
| Radio | > 1 mm | Cold gas |
| Infrared | 700 nm - 1 mm | Star formation |
| Visible | 400-700 nm | Stars, galaxies |
| Ultraviolet | 10-400 nm | Hot stars |
| X-ray | 0.01-10 nm | Very hot gas |
| Gamma ray | < 0.01 nm | Extreme events |

## Multi-wavelength:
- Different physics visible
- Combined picture
- Space telescopes for many bands

slides.title: Radiation Processes
slides.content:
# Radiation Processes

## Thermal Radiation:
- Blackbody radiation
- Stefan-Boltzmann: L = 4*pi*R^2*sigma*T^4
- Wien's law: peak wavelength ~ 1/T

## Non-Thermal:

| Process | Cause |
|---------|-------|
| Synchrotron | Electrons in magnetic field |
| Bremsstrahlung | Electron-ion interactions |
| Compton | Photon-electron scattering |

## Line Emission:
- Atomic transitions
- Identifies elements
- Temperature indicator

slides.title: Stellar Structure
slides.content:
# Inside Stars

## Hydrostatic Equilibrium:
- Gravity pulls in
- Pressure pushes out
- Balance = stable star

## Energy Transport:
- Radiative: Photons carry energy
- Convective: Gas circulates

## Stellar Layers:
- Core (fusion)
- Radiative zone
- Convective zone
- Photosphere (surface)
- Atmosphere (chromosphere, corona)

## Mass-Luminosity:
```
L ~ M^3.5 (approximately)
```

slides.title: Black Holes
slides.content:
# Black Holes

## Definition:
Object whose escape velocity exceeds light speed.

## Schwarzschild Radius:
```
Rs = 2GM/c^2
```

## Types:

| Type | Mass | Formation |
|------|------|----------|
| Stellar | 3-100 Msun | Star death |
| Intermediate | 100-100,000 | Uncertain |
| Supermassive | 10^6-10^10 | Galaxy centers |

## Properties:
- Event horizon: Point of no return
- Singularity: Central point
- No hair theorem: Mass, spin, charge only

slides.title: Black Hole Effects
slides.content:
# Black Hole Phenomena

## Accretion Disks:
- Material spirals in
- Heats up intensely
- Emits X-rays

## Jets:
- Relativistic outflows
- Perpendicular to disk
- Radio and X-ray emission

## Hawking Radiation:
- Quantum effect
- Black holes evaporate
- Very slow for large black holes

## Gravitational Waves:
- Black hole mergers
- Detected by LIGO/Virgo

slides.title: Neutron Stars
slides.content:
# Neutron Stars

## Formation:
- Core-collapse supernovae
- Remnant of massive star

## Properties:
- Mass: 1.4-2 Msun
- Radius: ~10 km
- Density: Nuclear density
- Magnetic field: 10^8-10^15 G

## Types:

| Type | Feature |
|------|--------|
| Pulsar | Regular radio pulses |
| Magnetar | Extreme magnetic field |
| X-ray binary | Accreting material |

## Pulsars:
- Rotating beacon
- Extremely precise clocks

slides.title: High-Energy Phenomena
slides.content:
# High-Energy Astrophysics

## Gamma-Ray Bursts:
- Most energetic explosions
- Short: Neutron star mergers
- Long: Massive star collapse

## Active Galactic Nuclei:
- Supermassive black holes accreting
- Quasars brightest
- Jets span galaxies

## Cosmic Rays:
- High-energy particles
- From supernovae, AGN
- Hit Earth's atmosphere

## Supernovae:
- Type Ia: Thermonuclear
- Core-collapse: Massive stars
- Create heavy elements

slides.title: Gravitational Waves
slides.content:
# Gravitational Waves

## Definition:
Ripples in spacetime fabric.

## Sources:
- Binary neutron stars
- Binary black holes
- Supernovae (asymmetric)

## Detection:
- LIGO (ground)
- Virgo (ground)
- LISA (future, space)

## First Detection:
- September 2015
- Two black holes merging
- GW150914

## Nobel Prize:
- 2017: Weiss, Barish, Thorne
- Multi-messenger astronomy born

slides.title: Cosmology Basics
slides.content:
# Cosmology

## Big Bang:
- Universe began ~13.8 billion years ago
- Expansion from hot, dense state

## Evidence:
- Cosmic microwave background
- Hubble expansion
- Light element abundances

## Dark Matter:
- ~27% of universe
- Doesn't emit light
- Detected by gravity

## Dark Energy:
- ~68% of universe
- Accelerating expansion
- Unknown nature

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Astrophysics Summary

## Gravity:
- Newton: F = GMm/r^2
- Einstein: Mass curves spacetime
- Gravitational waves detected

## Radiation:
- All electromagnetic wavelengths
- Thermal and non-thermal

## Compact Objects:
| Object | Endpoint of |
|--------|------------|
| White dwarf | Low-mass stars |
| Neutron star | Massive stars |
| Black hole | Very massive |

## High-Energy:
- GRBs, AGN, cosmic rays
- X-ray and gamma-ray astronomy

> **Congratulations!** You've completed Astrophysics!
